field.name: summary
field.value: keep all output in one place

field.name: description
field.value:
Currently, build output is copied to ${basedir}/build/${framework} but each project keeps its own ${projectroot}/bin output dir. Many projects resolve dependencies using ${other.project.root}/bin rather than ${basedir}/build/${framework}.
This is important when building for both .NET 1.1 and .NET 2.0. The framework-specific builds are in one place, but many projects use the last-built location. If you build all for 2.0 then try to build 'facilities' for 1.1, you have to rebuild 'tools', 'container', 'services', 'activerecord', and 'aspectsharp' first.
